intro: Vinca gulielmi-waldemarii, commonly known as the Waldemar's vinca, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which are usually pink or red, bloom in spring and summer, adding ornamental value to gardens. It is valued for its hardiness and ability to thrive in challenging environments.
